<<<<<<< HEAD
At the court at Whitehall the second of November, 1678 by the Kings Most Excellent Majesty and the Lords of His Majesties most honourable Privy Council : His Majesty was this day pleased to declare in Council, that whosoever shall make discovery of any officer or souldier of His Majesties horse or foot-guards, who having formerly taken the oaths of allegiance ... England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II) Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
1 broadside.
Printed by John Bill, Christopher Barker, Thomas Newcomb, and Henry Hills ..., London : 1678.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
=======
At the court at Whitehall the second of November, 1678 by the Kings Most Excellent Majesty and the Lords of His Majesties most honourable Privy Council : His Majesty was this day pleased to declare in Council, that whosoever shall make discovery of any officer or souldier of His Majesties horse or foot-guards, who having formerly taken the oaths of allegiance ... England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II) Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
1 broadside.
Printed by John Bill, Christopher Barker, Thomas Newcomb, and Henry Hills ..., London : 1678.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
